block.p: Dr. Lisa Stehli Kelly, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles J. Kelly of Washington, was married on Friday evening to Dr. Steven Sidney Wolf, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Wolf of McLean, Va. The Rev. Margaret Graham, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the home of the bride's parents.
Dr. Kelly, who is keeping her name, received a medical degree from Case Western Reserve University in May. She graduated from Harvard.

Dr. Lisa Stehli Kelly, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles J. Kelly of Washington, was married on Friday evening to Dr. Steven Sidney Wolf, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Wolf of McLean, Va. The Rev. Margaret Graham, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the home of the bride's parents.
Dr. Kelly, who is keeping her name, received a medical degree from Case Western Reserve University in May. She graduated from Harvard.

Her father retired as the managing director for investment banking at Weeden & Company in New York; he is also the founder of Citizens for Colin Powell, a presidential draft organization of which the bride's mother, Marguerite Kelly, is a director.

Dr. Wolf, a neurologist, is an officer of the United States Public Health Service and the director of neurology and chief of the medical staff of the District of Columbia's Commission on Mental Health. He graduated from George Washington University, where he also received a master's degree in neuro-chemistry and his medical degree.

The bridegroom's mother, Agnes Wolf, is the vice president for political affairs of the Women's National Democratic Club in Washington. His father, who is retired, was the director of the Social Progress Trust Fund and the program adviser to the president of the Inter-American Development Bank, both in Washington.
